definition: easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable
difference/discrepancy/to differ/error/to err/to make a mistake
to differ from/to fall short of/lacking/wrong/inferior/Taiwan pr. [cha1]

sentences.english: Cuts in export subsidies have not conspicuously shrunk China's massive trade surplus or export earnings so far.
sentences.chinese: 削减出口补贴并没有明显的降低中国的贸易顺差。

sentences.english: Trade surpluses and deficits derive from mispriced currencies arising from government manipulation.
sentences.chinese: 贸易顺差和逆差源于政府操纵引起的货币价格扭曲。

sentences.english: Currently, China's export volume is suffering a sharp drop and the trade surplus is decreasing significantly.
sentences.chinese: 目前我国外贸出口数量锐减，贸易顺差额明显下降。

sentences.english: Some economists predict the surplus could start to widen again this year.
sentences.chinese: 一些经济学家预测，今年中国贸易顺差可能再度扩大。

sentences.english: February's trade surplus was a near-record 23-point-eight billion dollars.
sentences.chinese: 2月贸易顺差为238亿美元，接近历史记录。

sentences.english: The favorable balance of trade means the resource mis- configuration.
sentences.chinese: 贸易顺差意味着资源错误配置。

sentences.english: China's trade surplus is projected at around $176.9 billion in 2007.
sentences.chinese: 此外，2007年的贸易顺差预计在1769亿左右。

sentences.english: Chinese forestry products foreign trade is the support of all-trade-balance.
sentences.chinese: 中国林产品对外贸易是全国贸易顺差的巨大支撑。

sentences.english: China does not seek trade surplus.
sentences.chinese: 中国从不追求贸易顺差。

sentences.english: China does not pursue a trade surplus, Wen said.
sentences.chinese: 中国不搞一个贸易顺差，闻先生说道。

pinyin: wai4 shang1 zhi2 jie1 tou2 zi1
